definition: shouting abuse in the street like a fishwife

sentences.english: Even if I am a virago now , that brought up by Mr, Su.
sentences.chinese: 就算我是潑婦，也是蘇淳一手培養出來的。

sentences.english: Beautiful angel temptation and charm of the vixen to seduce the devil, who won?
sentences.chinese: 美麗天使的誘惑和魅力的潑婦誘惑魔鬼，誰贏了？

sentences.english: Xizorboarded his advanced combat vessel, the Virago, andescaped to the skyhook.
sentences.chinese: 西做乘坐着他先進的戰鬥艦潑婦號逃向他的太空梭。

sentences.english: The Virago 's greatest drawback was its voracious power requirements.
sentences.chinese: “潑婦”號最大的缺點就是其巨大的能量消耗。

sentences.english: The shrew stands at the door and keeps shouting abuse.
sentences.chinese: 潑婦站在門口，不停地嫚罵。

sentences.english: I don't like my wife bitching around.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡我老婆到處潑婦罵街。

sentences.english: No matter, I like a bitch as loud cry, without looking.
sentences.chinese: 任憑我像個潑婦一樣，大聲哭喊，頭也不回。

sentences.english: Shaking with lee mother angry blame dong-qing li to find a tartar.
sentences.chinese: 李母氣的直哆嗦，埋怨李冬青找回來個潑婦。

sentences.english: Most of the time, I can be a real bitch.
sentences.chinese: 大多數情況下，我是個潑婦。

sentences.english: I do not like my wife bitching around.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡我老婆到處潑婦罵街。

sentences.english: The nice girl he had married grew into a shrew .
sentences.chinese: 那個本來挺和藹的女孩結婚後成爲了一個潑婦。

sentences.english: She is the bitch from hell.
sentences.chinese: 她是個壞得冒水的潑婦。

sentences.english: Begone, for God's sake, and hide your vixen face!
sentences.chinese: 看在上帝的份上，滾吧，把你那潑婦的臉藏起來。

sentences.english: No one wants to marry a vulgar shrew.
sentences.chinese: 沒人願意和一個粗俗的潑婦結婚。

sentences.english: The street talk a lane to smell a virago conjecture in the soft rib ache beauty lightly crumple.
sentences.chinese: 街談巷聞潑婦虛擬中，軟肋疼痛紅顏輕輕揉。

definition: young married woman/mistress/(fig.) punching bag/(old) child bride
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
worse than a beast/to behave immorally
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
fig. restless, because of fear or strong emotions
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
